meanings.definition: The quality or state of being salty.
meanings.sent1: I could taste the saltinesses of the ocean in every bite of the seafood soup.
meanings.sent2: The chef adjusted the dish to enhance the natural saltinesses of the ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The saltinesses of the chips made my mouth pucker in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her tears carried the saltinesses of her sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The air was filled with the saltinesses of the sea, creating a refreshing atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The presence of salt or a salty taste.
meanings.sent1: The saltinesses of the pretzel added to its deliciousness.
meanings.sent2: I could detect the subtle saltinesses in the air near the beach.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected saltinesses of the cake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The saltinesses of the soup reminded me of home.
meanings.sent5: The saltinesses of the popcorn made it the perfect movie snack.

meanings.definition: A feeling of bitterness or resentment.
meanings.sent1: The saltinesses in her tone revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide the saltinesses in his expression during the argument.
meanings.sent3: Despite his saltinesses, he couldn't help but smile at the joke.
meanings.sent4: The saltinesses in her words lingered long after the conversation ended.
meanings.sent5: His eyes held a hint of saltinesses as he watched his rival succeed.
